title: Awesome List Updates on May 26, 2021
_seo_title: Awesome List Updates on May 26, 2021 - Track Awesome List

items.title: Awesome Privacy
items.content_text:
### Encryption

*   [Cryptomator](https://cryptomator.org/) - Cryptomator encrypts your data quickly and easily. Afterwards you upload them protected to your favorite cloud service.

### Video and Audio

*   [Stremio](https://www.stremio.com/) - Stremio is a modern media center that's a one-stop solution for your video entertainment.

### Payments

*   Bank payments (wire, SEPA, etc)
items.content_html:
Encryption

  • Cryptomator - Cryptomator encrypts your data quickly and easily. Afterwards you upload them protected to your favorite cloud service.

Video and Audio

  • Stremio - Stremio is a modern media center that's a one-stop solution for your video entertainment.

Payments

  • Bank payments (wire, SEPA, etc)

items.title: Awesome Broadcasting
items.content_text:
### Monitoring & Quality Control

*   [MXF Inspect (⭐47)](https://github.com/Myriadbits/MXFInspect) - A Windows tool to display the internal structure of an MXF (Material eXchange Format) file.
items.content_html:
Monitoring & Quality Control

  • MXF Inspect (⭐47) - A Windows tool to display the internal structure of an MXF (Material eXchange Format) file.

items.title: Awesome Swift
items.content_text:
### Payment / Barcode

*   [TPInAppReceipt (⭐667)](https://github.com/tikhop/TPInAppReceipt) - A lightweight, pure-Swift library for reading and validating Apple In App Purchase Receipt locally.
items.content_html:
Payment / Barcode

  • TPInAppReceipt (⭐667) - A lightweight, pure-Swift library for reading and validating Apple In App Purchase Receipt locally.

items.title: Awesome Irc
items.content_text:
### Clients

*   [relay.js (⭐163)](https://github.com/Fauntleroy/relay.js) - Focuses on making IRC less intimidating and easier to use. `Web`

### Channels / Platforms

*   [#ubuntu](https://wiki.ubuntu.com/IRC/ChannelList)@Libera.Chat - Official Ubuntu support channel. ([rules](https://wiki.ubuntu.com/IRC/Guidelines))

### Networks / Platforms

*   [Libera.Chat](https://libera.chat) - Network mostly focused on free and open source projects, run by former freenode staff.

### Articles / Platforms

*   [IRC is dead, long live IRC](https://www.pingdom.com/blog/irc-is-dead-long-live-irc/) - Pingdom.
items.content_html:
Clients

  • relay.js (⭐163) - Focuses on making IRC less intimidating and easier to use. Web

Channels / Platforms

  • #ubuntu@Libera.Chat - Official Ubuntu support channel. (rules)

Networks / Platforms

  • Libera.Chat - Network mostly focused on free and open source projects, run by former freenode staff.

Articles / Platforms

  • IRC is dead, long live IRC - Pingdom.

items.title: Awesome Quant
items.content_text:
### Python / Indicators

*   [lppls (⭐415)](https://github.com/Boulder-Investment-Technologies/lppls) - A Python module for fitting the [Log-Periodic Power Law Singularity (LPPLS)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Didier_Sornette#The_JLS_and_LPPLS_models) model.

### R / Backtesting

*   [quantstrat (⭐299)](https://github.com/braverock/quantstrat) - Transaction-oriented infrastructure for constructing trading systems and simulation. Provides support for multi-asset class and multi-currency portfolios for backtesting and other financial research.
items.content_html:
Python / Indicators

  • lppls (⭐415) - A Python module for fitting the Log-Periodic Power Law Singularity (LPPLS) model.

R / Backtesting

  • quantstrat (⭐299) - Transaction-oriented infrastructure for constructing trading systems and simulation. Provides support for multi-asset class and multi-currency portfolios for backtesting and other financial research.

items.title: Awesome Vite
items.content_text:
### Framework-agnostic Plugins / Helpers

*   [vite-plugin-vconsole (⭐83)](https://github.com/vadxq/vite-plugin-vconsole) - Help developers use vconsole to facilitate mobile development and debugging.
items.content_html:
Framework-agnostic Plugins / Helpers

items.title: Public Apis
items.content_text:

- API: [Notion](https://developers.notion.com/docs/getting-started)

  Auth: `OAuth`

  HTTPS: Yes

  CORS: Unknown
